Understanding Sikh Philosophy

The Three Pillars of Sikhism

The three fundamental principles of Sikhi that guide daily living and spiritual practice

NAAM JAPO

Meditate on God's Name

"Remember the One, who pervades all creation; God's Name is the Support of the soul."
‚Äî Guru Nanak Dev Ji

Key Practices of NAAM JAPO

üéµ
Kirtan

Singing hymns and devotional songs from the Guru Granth Sahib, accompanied by traditional instruments like the harmonium, tabla, and stringed instruments.

üìñ
Paath

Recitation of scriptures like Japji Sahib, Rehras Sahib, and Sukhmani Sahib with focus on understanding the meaning and applying the teachings in daily life.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Simran

Silent meditation on God's name (Waheguru), practiced individually or in a group setting to cultivate inner peace and divine connection.

Learn More

KIRAT KARO

Earn an Honest Living

"He who earns with the sweat of his brow and shares with others, has discovered the path of righteousness."
‚Äî Guru Nanak Dev Ji

Key Practices of KIRAT KARO

üõ†Ô∏è
Ethical Work

Pursuing an occupation that adheres to moral principles and benefits society, while avoiding exploitative or harmful activities.

üí™
Hard Work

Embracing diligence and dedication in all endeavors, reflecting commitment to excellence and service in both professional and personal life.

üå±
Self-Reliance

Maintaining independence through honest labor while contributing to family and community, avoiding dependency on others for basic needs.

Learn More

VAND CHHAKO

Share with Others

"The one who shares what they have, shall receive treasures in abundance."
‚Äî Guru Arjan Dev Ji

Key Practices of VAND CHHAKO

üç≤
Langar

The community kitchen where free meals are served to all visitors regardless of faith, caste, gender, economic status or ethnicity, promoting equality and inclusion.

ü§≤
Dasvandh

Contributing one-tenth (10%) of one's income to charitable causes and community development, supporting those in need.

‚ù§Ô∏è
Seva

Selfless service without expectation of reward or recognition, done with humility and love for humanity, reflecting divine connection.

Learn More

Our Services

How We Serve The Community

We are committed to serving humanity through various programs centered around Sikh principles of equality, service, and compassion.

Langar Services

Free community kitchen providing meals to all visitors regardless of background.

Learn more ‚Üí

Prayer Services

Daily prayer services including Nitnem, Rehras Sahib, and Kirtan sessions.

Learn more ‚Üí

Education Programs

Sikh history, philosophy, and language classes for all age groups.

Learn more ‚Üí

Community Support

Social services, counseling, and support for community members in need.

Learn more ‚Üí

Youth Activities

Sports, camps, and leadership programs designed for Sikh youth.

Learn more ‚Üí

Cultural Events

Celebrations of Gurpurabs, festivals, and cultural programs throughout the year.

Learn more ‚Üí
View All Services
